boardgame.name: Pacific War: The Struggle Against Japan 1941-1945
boardgame.description: Pacific War is a strategic wargame that takes players from the attack on Pearl Harbor through the climactic summer of 1945... from Australia to China, from Burma to Hawaii... from the defense of Wake Island to the Guadalcanal campaign to the massive actions fought in desperate defense of the Japanese homeland._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;For the first time in a Pacific Theater game, size, subtlety, and ease of play have come together in a game of sharp action and historical accuracy. Players can become familiar with the layered Pacific War systems in the solitaire Engagement Scenarios, fighting their way through increasinly panoramic Battle, Campaign, and Strategic two-player and multi-player Scenarios. Building on the game's basic maneuver and combat systems, players learn to conduct strategic bombing, merchant shipping attition, search and detection, amphibious assaults, and extensive Operations whose duration and cost they determine themselves._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Pacific War is a source of limitless challenge and excitement for every gamer ever fascinated with the vastness and fury of the Pacific Campaigns._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Most of the counters are unpunched. All maps and charts in superb condition. 2 copies of the scenario booklets in excellent condition. But (and this is why the game isn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t marked _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;very good_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;) the rules booklet is a photocopy, albeit a good one.
Unpunched. Box has ding on one corner. Doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t affect play.

Victory games Pacific war mega game. General: In excellent condition, punched and I believe to be complete (all component checked except counters) Box: In excellent condition, a little rubbing on one corner no splits or tears Counters: 2340 quote, not checked, but all the counter are organised in either the counter tray, bags or match boxes and appropriately labelled. Rules: in excellent condition 56 pages, no marks Scenario book: Excellent condition also, there are a number of errata points and extra notes lightly marked up in pencil Errata sheet: One page in excellent condition, one mistake corrected in pencil. Maps: Excellent condition, only some minor wear on the corners Display sheets: 2 one Japanese one Allied both in excellent condition Operations sheet: one in excellent condition Force display screens: 2 one Japanese one Allied both in excellent condition Force display sheets: 8 four Japanese four Allied all in excellent condition, Allied display sheets 2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;3 are marked Japanese display sheets 2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;3. The information on the allied a Japanese is identical (there basically for putting you task force units on) so I assume that this is either a packing or printing error by Victory Games. On these two sheets Japanese has been crossed out and Allied written lightly in pencil. Replacement record sheets: One pad of approximately 25, perfect condition Dice: 1D10 Weight: 1600g unpacked, 2000g packed in a cardboard box with bubble wrap Note: An extra set of rules and scenario book is also available
Unpunched. Some slight box wear.

The two countertrays are included in the deal. Shipping _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Handling: Germany: 7 Euro International: please ask me in advance (before clicking _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;BUY!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;) with your mailing priorities (land/surface etc.). Please note that the Deutsche Post (www.deutschepost.de, language may be switched to english) is rather expensive (e.g. roughly 2x more expensive for sending from Germany to US when vice versa). I attend the GHS Con at Braunfels (Germany), thus if you also attend you may pick up the game there.

MISSING: Japanese Force Display card #1 (photocopy available on demand) 1 x 10-sided die 29 Counters 2 x Allied Airfields (out of 150 generic) 1 x Japanese Airfield (out of 100 generic) 6 x Numeric #7/#8 1 x Dutch Air unit (1-8-4-0-2) 2 x US Infantry (41st,81st) 1 x US Engineer (#15) 1 x Chinese Infantry (#8) 1 x British Armor (#7) 1 x Japanese Carrier (1, Hosho) 1 x Japanese Light Cruiser (8, Yubari) 1 x Japanese Submarine (#3) 2 x Japanese Air (3-1-2.4-7-7) 6 x Japanese Infantry (#8 Eng/#4,14 Mar/#4,11 Reg/#9 Brig) 3 x Misc (PHASE,2 x Supply) Components and their condition: BOX - Poor. Taped, heavy wear, a couples small holes. RULES - Good. Nothing written in the book, but the spine is a bit warped and the pages show their age. SCENARIO BOOK - Good. A little bit of fraying and browning on the cover pages. MAP A - Good. Bottom edge has some tape, but nothing that affects play MAP B - Good. Top edge has some tape wear, but nothing that affects play. Minor wear along some of the fold creases. The previous owner cut the map extension away from this mapsheet, and it is present an in good condition. DISPLAY SHEETS (x2) - Very Good. OPERATION DISPLAY - Good. A little browning, and a light dime-size smudge that does not interfere with any informational items. SCREENS (x2) - Very Good. FORCE DISPLAYS (x7) - Good. Very minor markings on half of them. RECORD SHEET PAD - Very Good. Between 20-25 sheets remaining.

Pictures on request. Map condition is ok. The rest is excellent. Never played by the looks of it. Partially punched (around 20%). Punched counters in 2 trays. A more detailed description of condition: Box: Some shelfwear, particular on corners. Very light wear, age considered. Backside of box has much wear / scratches (probably from moving the box around to get to other games) Counters: No apparent discolouration. 2 trays with punched counters, rest is unpunched. Scenario booklet 1: Pages appears unused (no bending), but 1 of 2 stables have gone off. Scenario booklet 2: As scenario booklet 1 Rules of Play: Pages appears unused. Only sign of use is it _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;opens up easily_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Map A: A bit of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;white_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; where is has been folded. Map B: More pronounced white lines than map A. Still what can be expected from a map this age. Also it has a bit of bending, seems like it has been in slightly humid weather. Replacement Record Sheet: Not sure how many has been used, but plenty left (25?). No bending. Japanese Display Sheet: Like new. Allied Display Sheet: Like new. Japanese Screen: Like new. Allied Screen: Like new. Operation Display: Like new. Errata: Like new. Various force displays: Like new.
